en: Drivers have to attend to the traffic signal.
zh: 司机得留意交通信号灯。

en: The driver maintained a high speed.
zh: 司机一直开得很快。

en: Drivers must observe the traffic rules.
zh: 司机必须遵守交通规则。

en: The driver advised us to fasten our seat belts.
zh: 司机提醒我们要系好安全带。

en: The rules drivers should keep are as follows.
zh: 司机该遵守的规则如下。

en: It was obvious that the driver had not been careful enough.
zh: 很明显，司机当时不够小心。

en: I got my driver's license on the second time I tried to pass the driver's test.
zh: 我考了两次才拿到驾照。

en: The motorman slowed down the train.
zh: 司机让火车减速了。

en: You should obey the traffic laws when you drive.
zh: 开车时要遵守交通规则。

en: He managed to pass his driving test even though he was a poor driver.
zh: 他虽然车技一般，但还是设法考过了驾照。

en: You cannot be too careful when you drive.
zh: 开车再怎么小心都不为过。

en: You have to look out for other cars when you drive.
zh: 开车时你得留意其他车辆。

en: You're too drunk to drive.
zh: 你醉得没法开车了。

en: Fasten your seat belt when you drive.
zh: 开车时记得系好安全带。

en: You are not to speak to the man at the wheel.
zh: 不要跟正在开车的人说话。

en: You should concentrate on the road when you're driving.
zh: 开车时应该集中注意力看路。

en: The driver was so fortunate as to escape death.
zh: 司机命大，捡回了一条命。

en: Take your chance, and do it.
zh: 抓住机会，去干吧。

en: The fare is one dollar each way.
zh: 单程票价是一块钱。

en: Unfortunately the telephone was out of order.
zh: 真不凑巧，电话坏了。

en: Allan was lucky and passed the tax accountant examination.
zh: 艾伦运气好，考过了税务师考试。

en: As good luck would have it, a steamer passed by and they were saved.
zh: 碰巧有艘轮船经过，他们得救了。

en: Bring as many boxes as you can carry.
zh: 能拿多少盒子就拿多少。

en: He was among those chosen.
zh: 他是被选中的人之一。

en: Fortunately, I've got you to talk to.
zh: 还好有你能跟我说说话。

en: I am happy about your good luck.
zh: 我真为你走运感到高兴。

en: Luck turned in my favor.
zh: 我转运了。

en: It's a godsend.
zh: 真是老天保佑。

en: Oh, I'm just going to take it easy.
zh: 噢，我只想放松放松。

en: I have no time to engage in gossip.
zh: 我没时间在那儿八卦。

en: The media got wind of a rumor about his engagement and came quickly.
zh: 媒体听到了他订婚的风声，赶紧跑了过来。

en: Speak of angels and you hear their wings.
zh: 说曹操，曹操到。

en: Speak of the devil, here comes Kathy.
zh: 说曹操，曹操到，凯西来了。

en: The rumor is not true as far as I know.
zh: 据我所知，那个传闻不是真的。

en: The rumor turned out false.
zh: 结果证明传闻是假的。

en: The rumor turned out true.
zh: 结果证明传闻是真的。

en: The rumor soon went about.
zh: 谣言很快就传开了。

en: Rumor says that she is a pickpocket.
zh: 有传言说她是个扒手。

en: There are rumors in the air.
zh: 到处都在传流言蜚语。

en: The scuttlebutt is they're going to Australia.
zh: 小道消息说他们要去澳大利亚。

en: Lying and stealing live next door to each other.
zh: 撒谎和偷窃是不分家的。

en: It is wrong to tell a lie.
zh: 撒谎是不对的。

en: I was made out to be a liar.
zh: 我被说成了个骗子。

en: It is wrong to tell lies.
zh: 撒谎是不对的。

en: To tell a lie is wrong.
zh: 撒谎是错误的。

en: If you tell too many lies, people won't ever believe your words.
zh: 谎话说多了，就没人会信你了。

en: You are lying.
zh: 你在撒谎。

en: Please forgive me for telling a lie.
zh: 请原谅我撒了谎。

en: His lie weighed on his conscience.
zh: 他的谎言让他良心不安。

en: The end justifies the means.
zh: 只要能达到目的，可以不择手段。

en: Never tell a lie!
zh: 千万别撒谎！

en: He's above telling a lie.
zh: 他这种人是不屑于撒谎的。

en: You're always lying- that's why people don't take you seriously. You get what you deserve.
zh: 你老是撒谎，难怪没人把你当回事。这就是你自找的。

en: He was angry at the suggestion that he was dishonest.
zh: 别人暗示他不诚实，他气坏了。

en: No kidding!?
zh: 真的假的？！

en: Many a true word is spoken in jest.
zh: 很多真话都是当玩笑说出来的。

en: He was looking for it like a hunting dog.
zh: 他找起东西来跟猎犬似的。

en: We should lay on a second coat of paint for better protection against the weather.
zh: 咱们得再刷层漆，好挡挡风雨。

en: Although rainforests make up only two percent of the earth's surface, over half the world's wild plant, animal and insect species live there.
zh: 虽说雨林只占地球表面积的百分之二，但世界上超过一半的野生动植物和昆虫都住在那儿。

en: An absence of rain caused wild plants to die.
zh: 因为一直没下雨，野草都枯死了。

en: In case of rain, the athletic meeting will be called off.
zh: 万一下雨，运动会就取消了。

en: Telephone me if it rains.
zh: 要是下雨了，给我打个电话。

en: After rain comes fair weather.
zh: 雨过天晴。

en: The rain-water runs off through this pipe.
zh: 雨水是从这根管子排走的。

en: It is cool after the rain.
zh: 雨后挺凉快的。

en: The leaves are fresh after a rainfall.
zh: 雨后的叶子看着特别鲜绿。

en: Let's get out of the rain.
zh: 咱们快去躲躲雨吧。

en: Do you go to school by bus on a rainy day?
zh: 下雨天你坐公交上学吗？

en: It's a rainy day.
zh: 今天是个下雨天。

en: It's a rainy day, so we can't play outside.
zh: 今天下雨，我们没法去外面玩。

en: Do you have rain gear with you?
zh: 你带雨具了吗？

en: It seems that the rainy season has set in.
zh: 看来是进入雨季了。

en: The rainy season has set in.
zh: 进入雨季了。

en: The rainy season begins in June.
zh: 雨季是从六月份开始的。

en: There is no telling when the rainy season will be over.
zh: 谁也说不准雨季什么时候结束。

en: It feels like rain.
zh: 感觉要下雨了。

en: It looks rainy.
zh: 看着要下雨。

en: What with the rain and a bad hotel, we didn't enjoy our holiday much.
zh: 又是下雨又是酒店太差，这假期玩得一点都不开心。

en: The rain lasted through the night.
zh: 这雨下了一整夜。

en: The rain came down in earnest.
zh: 雨真下起来了。

en: The rain soaked through my clothes.
zh: 雨水把我的衣服都淋透了。

en: The rain is coming down in earnest.
zh: 雨下得正猛呢。

en: The rain had a good effect on the farm crops.
zh: 这场雨对庄稼很有好处。

en: It was raining all day long without intermission.
zh: 雨下了一整天，中间都没停过。

en: It rained nonstop.
zh: 雨一直没停。

en: It has stopped raining.
zh: 雨停了。

en: The rain changed into snow.
zh: 雨变成了雪。

en: The rain lasted four days.
zh: 雨连着下了四天。

en: I don't think it will rain, but I'll take an umbrella in case it does.
zh: 我觉得不会下雨，但还是带把伞吧，以防万一。

en: In spite of the rain, we enjoyed our holiday.
zh: 尽管下着雨，我们假期玩得还是挺开心的。

en: It will stop raining soon.
zh: 雨很快就会停的。

en: It rained heavily.
zh: 雨下得很大。

en: The rain never let up all night.
zh: 雨下一整夜都没小过。

en: The rain lasted a week.
zh: 雨下了一星期。

en: Though it stopped raining, the wind was still blowing hard.
zh: 虽然雨停了，但风还刮得很大。

en: The rain shows no sign of stopping.
zh: 这雨一点儿要停的意思都没有。

en: Instead of stopping, the rain increased.
zh: 雨没停，反而下得更大了。

en: The rain hasn't stopped yet, has it?
zh: 雨还没停吧？

en: Has it stopped raining yet?
zh: 雨停了吗？

en: The rain's letting up soon.
zh: 雨马上就要小了。

en: It is raining all the time.
zh: 老是在下雨。

en: The rain has lasted for the past two days.
zh: 这雨已经连着下了两天了。

en: When did it begin to rain?
zh: 什么时候开始下雨的？

en: The rain lasted five days.
zh: 这雨连着下了五天。

en: The rain fell even harder.
zh: 雨下得更大了。

en: The rain continued all day.
zh: 雨下了一整天。

en: Does the amount of rain affect the growth of crops?
zh: 降雨量会影响庄稼生长吗？

en: I go to the office by bicycle except on rainy days.
zh: 除了下雨天，我平时都骑车上班。

en: Rainy days make me depressed.
zh: 下雨天让我心情很郁闷。

en: The best bet on a rainy day is to remain indoors.
zh: 下雨天最好的办法就是待在屋里。

en: How will they amuse the children on a wet afternoon?
zh: 这种下雨的下午，他们要怎么哄孩子玩呢？

en: Don't you find it unpleasant walking in the rain?
zh: 你不觉得在雨里走很不舒服吗？

en: I like to walk in the rain.
zh: 我喜欢在雨里散步。

en: I would rather stay at home than go out in the rain.
zh: 我宁愿待在家里，也不想冒雨出门。

en: He caught a chill because he went out in the rain.
zh: 他因为冒雨出门着凉了。

en: Standing in the rain brought on a bad cold.
zh: 在雨里淋着让他得了重感冒。

en: A bicycle will rust if you leave it in the rain.
zh: 自行车要是搁在雨里淋会生锈的。

en: I feel like singing in the rain.
zh: 我想在雨中唱歌。

en: In case it rains, I won't go.
zh: 要是下雨的话，我就不去了。

en: In the event of rain, the game will not be held.
zh: 如果下雨，比赛就不举行了。

en: Take your coat in case it rains.
zh: 带上外套吧，万一下雨呢。

en: After the rain, the sun emerged from the clouds.
zh: 雨停后，太阳从云里钻了出来。

en: We had to call off the baseball game because of the rain.
zh: 因为下雨，我们不得不取消了棒球赛。

en: The rain compelled the water to run over the banks.
zh: 大雨让河口漫过了堤岸。

en: The rain prevented me from going.
zh: 下雨耽误了我去。

en: Because of rain, I could not go out.
zh: 因为下雨，我没法出门。

en: The rain kept us from going out.
zh: 雨大得我们没法出门。

en: The rain prevented me from coming.
zh: 因为下雨，我没能来。

en: Because of the rain they had to cancel the game.
zh: 因为下雨，他们不得不取消了比赛。

en: The rain damped their spirits.
zh: 这场雨让他们很扫兴。

en: We had to call off the game because of rain.
zh: 因为下雨，我们只好取消了比赛。

en: We called off the game on account of rain.
zh: 因为下雨的缘故，我们取消了比赛。

en: The rain prevented us from playing baseball.
zh: 下雨害得我们没法打棒球。

en: I stayed home because of the rain.
zh: 因为下雨，我待在家里。

en: The rain prevented us from finishing our game of tennis.
zh: 因为下雨，我们的网球赛没能打完。

en: We had to call off the game because of the rain.
zh: 我们因为下雨不得不取消了比赛。

en: Rain prevented us from taking a walk.
zh: 下雨害得我们没法去散步。

en: Owing to the rain, the athletic meeting was put off.
zh: 由于下雨，运动会推迟了。

en: The picnic was put off on account of rain.
zh: 野餐因为下雨推迟了。

en: The game was called off on account of the rain.
zh: 比赛因为下雨取消了。

en: The rain prevented us from playing tennis outside.
zh: 下雨让我们没法在室外打网球。

en: The baseball game was called off due to rain.
zh: 棒球赛因为下雨被取消了。

en: The baseball game was drawn because of the rain.
zh: 因为下雨，棒球赛打成了平局。

en: The rain prevented him from coming here.
zh: 下雨害得他没能过来。

en: The rain prevented the boys from playing baseball on the playground.
zh: 下雨让男孩子们没法在操场上打棒球。

en: Because of the rain, the audience at the concert was small.
zh: 因为下雨，音乐会的观众很少。

en: The rain made it impossible for us to go on the picnic.
zh: 下雨让我们没法去野餐了。

en: The rain kept the baseball team idle yesterday.
zh: 因为下雨，棒球队昨天歇了一天。

en: The rain made it impossible for me to drive fast.
zh: 雨太大了，我没法开快车。

en: The garden was destroyed after the rain.
zh: 大雨过后，花园被毁了。

en: After the rain, there were puddles on the street.
zh: 雨后街上到处是积水。

en: Wind accompanied the rain.
zh: 又是刮风又是下雨的。

en: Stay out of the rain.
zh: 别淋着雨。

en: Take this umbrella with you lest you should get wet and catch cold.
zh: 带着这把伞，免得淋湿了感冒。

en: I was caught in the rain and got wet.
zh: 我淋了雨，身上都湿透了。

en: The paint is peeling off the weather-beaten wall.
zh: 墙漆被风吹雨淋得都掉了。

en: I was caught in the rain.
zh: 我被雨淋了个正着。

en: Strong winds accompanied the rain.
zh: 狂风暴雨的。

en: We are in for rain.
zh: 看来这雨是躲不掉了。

en: Besides the rain, we experienced heavy winds.
zh: 除了下雨，风还特别大。

en: We played golf in spite of the rain.
zh: 我们冒雨打了场高尔夫。

en: He went out in spite of the rain.
zh: 尽管下着雨，他还是出门了。

en: He started in spite of the rain.
zh: 尽管下着雨，他还是动身了。

en: The children went to school in spite of the rain.
zh: 即使下着雨，孩子们也去上学了。

en: In spite of the rain, the game was not cancelled.
zh: 虽然下雨，比赛也没取消。

en: In spite of the rain, I went out.
zh: 尽管下雨，我还是出门了。

en: I get caught in the rain, I'm late for my date, and I lose my pocketbook. It's just one thing after another today.
zh: 又是淋雨，又是约会迟到，还丢了钱包。今天真是一桩接一桩的倒霉事。

en: I don't suppose it's going to rain.
zh: 我看这雨下不起来。

en: The rain was preceded by wind.
zh: 下雨前先刮了一阵风。

en: They say we're going to get rain!
zh: 听说要下雨呢！

en: It looks like rain.
zh: 看着像要下雨。

en: He said that he was afraid it would be rainy.
zh: 他说他担心会下雨。

en: You had better take an umbrella with you in case it rains.
zh: 你最好带把伞，万一下雨呢。

en: It looks like rain. We had better shut the windows.
zh: 看着要下雨，咱们还是把窗户关了吧。

en: I discouraged him from going swimming as it was likely to rain.
zh: 看着要下雨，我就劝他先别去游泳了。

en: It looks like rain. You had better take an umbrella with you.
zh: 看着要下雨，你最好带把伞。

en: I'm afraid it will be rainy.
zh: 我担心会下雨。

en: I was caught in the rain and got soaked to the skin.
zh: 我被雨淋了个透，全身都湿了。

en: The beautiful scene of a lake was not able to be enjoyed because of rain and fog.
zh: 又是下雨又是起雾，湖上的美景都没看成。

en: The rain laid the dust.
zh: 这场雨把灰尘都压住了。

en: It was a week of alternate snow and rain.
zh: 这一周又是雨又是雪的。

en: The leaves look fresh in the rain.
zh: 雨里的叶子看着真鲜亮。

en: The rainy weather prevented her from working in the garden.
zh: 阴雨天气害得她没法在园子里干活。

en: I was late because of the rain.
zh: 因为下雨，我迟到了。

en: The rain prevented me from going out.
zh: 雨太大了，我没法出门。

en: The rain discouraged us from going out.
zh: 这雨下的，我们都不想出门了。

en: The rain set our plans back two weeks.
zh: 这场雨让我们的计划推后了两周。

en: The rain kept the fire from spreading.
zh: 这场雨让火势没能蔓延开。

en: The rain necessitated a postponement of the picnic.
zh: 因为下雨，野餐不得不延期了。

en: The rain spoiled our picnic.
zh: 这场雨把咱们的野餐全搞砸了。

en: You may go cycling if it doesn't rain.
zh: 不下雨的话，你就可以去骑车。

en: Whether it will rain or not, the game is going to be held.
zh: 不管下不下雨，比赛都照常举行。

en: It being rainy, I could not go out.
zh: 下雨呢，我没法出门。

en: It being rainy, I stayed home.
zh: 因为下雨，我就待在家里了。

en: Because of rain, we couldn't go to the beach.
zh: 下雨了，咱们去不成海边了。

en: It began raining in earnest.
zh: 雨真的开始下大了。

en: It began to rain cats and dogs.
zh: 下起瓢泼大雨了。

en: The rain came down in buckets.
zh: 雨下得跟从盆里倒出来似的。

en: Down came the rain in torrents.
zh: 大雨哗哗地落了下来。

en: Wet and stormy areas will get wetter and stormier.
zh: 原本多雨多风的地方，以后雨会更大，风暴会更猛。

en: The rain whipped against the window.
zh: 雨水抽打着窗户。

en: The rain is beating against the window.
zh: 雨点正在拍打窗户。

en: The rain is beating against the windows.
zh: 雨点正在拍打窗子。

en: The rain was beating hard against the windowpane.
zh: 雨点猛烈地敲打着窗玻璃。

en: The rain began to turn into snow.
zh: 雨开始变成雪了。

en: The rain changed to snow.
zh: 雨变成了雪。

en: We had hoped that the rain would stop before noon.
zh: 我们本希望雨能在中午前停。

en: When the rain stopped, the game of tennis was continued immediately.
zh: 雨一停，网球赛就立刻恢复了。

en: When the weather had cleared, the children began to play baseball again.
zh: 天一放晴，孩子们就又开始打棒球了。

en: After the rain had let up a bit, we made a dash for the car.
zh: 雨小了点以后，我们赶紧跑向了车子。

en: The rains entered a lull.
zh: 雨势缓和了下来。

en: The rain penetrated my raincoat.
zh: 雨水渗进了我的雨衣。

en: I wish it would stop raining.
zh: 真希望雨快点停。

en: At any rate, I can go out when it stops raining.
zh: 反正雨停了我就能出门了。

en: Let's go as soon as it stops raining.
zh: 雨一停我们就走。

en: With the rain having stopped, the game began again.
zh: 雨停了，比赛又开始了。

en: Hardly had the rain stopped when the ground began to freeze.
zh: 雨刚停，地就开始结冰了。

en: No sooner had it stopped raining than a beautiful rainbow appeared.
zh: 雨刚停，天空中就出现了一道美丽的彩虹。

en: We won't go out unless it stops raining.
zh: 除非雨停，否则我们不出门。

en: It rained for three days on end.
zh: 雨连着下了三天。

en: It doesn't matter whether it rains or shines.
zh: 不管晴天还是下雨都无所谓。

en: Whether it rains or not, I won't change my plan.
zh: 不管下不下雨，我都不打算改计划。

en: I'll be there rain or shine.
zh: 风雨无阻，我一定会到。

en: Whether it rains or not, Fujita is planning to have a picnic.
zh: 不管下不下雨，藤田都打算去野餐。

en: When it rains, it pours.
zh: 祸不单行。

en: He won't come if it rains.
zh: 要是下雨他就不来了。

en: If it rains, the game will be put off.
zh: 要是下雨，比赛就会推迟。

en: I'll stay if it rains.
zh: 要是下雨我就留下。

en: If it rains, the game will be canceled.
zh: 如果下雨，比赛就会取消。

en: The rain will revive this tree.
zh: 这场雨会让这棵树恢复生机的。

en: I'll take in the washing before it rains.
zh: 我得在下雨前把衣服收进来。

en: When it rains, the buses are late more often than not.
zh: 下雨天公交车十有八九会晚点。

en: It threatens to rain.
zh: 天看着要下雨。

en: We prayed for rain.
zh: 我们祈求下雨。

en: I have a hunch that it will rain.
zh: 我预感会下雨。

en: It's raining, so we should go home.
zh: 下雨了，我们回家吧。

en: Every time it rains, the roof leaks.
zh: 每次下雨屋顶都漏水。

en: When it rains, she feels blue.
zh: 只要一下雨，她就心情不好。

en: When it rains, she takes the bus.
zh: 下雨的时候她会坐公交车。

en: Our streets flood when we have rain.
zh: 下雨时，我们这里的街道就会淹。

en: Did the newspaper say it was going to rain?
zh: 报纸上说要下雨吗？

en: I am afraid it will be rainy.
zh: 我担心会下雨。

en: Take your umbrella with you in case it rains.
zh: 带把伞吧，万一下雨呢。

en: I took my umbrella for fear of rain.
zh: 怕下雨，我带了把伞。

en: Don't forget to take an umbrella in case it rains.
zh: 别忘了带伞，以防下雨。

en: Don't forget to bring your umbrella in case it rains.
zh: 记得带伞，万一下雨。

en: Since it is bad when it rains, when you come out of the room, please shut the window.
zh: 下雨很麻烦，所以离开房间时请关上窗户。

en: You'd better take your umbrella, just in case it rains.
zh: 你最好带上伞，以防万一。

en: I took my umbrella lest it rain.
zh: 我带了把伞，怕下雨。

en: I took an umbrella in case it should rain.
zh: 我带了把伞，以防下雨。

en: I think you'd better take an umbrella in case it rains.
zh: 我看你最好带把伞，万一下雨呢。

en: Take an umbrella with you in case it should rain.
zh: 带把伞吧，万一下雨。

en: Take an umbrella with you in case it rains.
zh: 带把伞，万一下雨呢。

en: Remember to take your umbrella, in case it rains.
zh: 记着带伞，万一下雨。

en: Is it going to rain?
zh: 要下雨了吗？

en: He observed that we should probably have rain.
zh: 他说可能要下雨。

en: We thought it would rain; nevertheless, we started on our trip.
zh: 我们以为会下雨，但还是出发了。

en: I said it might rain.
zh: 我说过可能会下雨。

en: It may rain, and then again, it may not.
zh: 没准儿会下雨，也没准儿不下。

en: It may rain, but I will go today anyhow.
zh: 可能会下雨，但我今天反正得去。

en: It's been raining since last night.
zh: 从昨晚就开始下雨了。

en: It may rain.
zh: 可能会下雨。

en: We had better start before it begins to rain.
zh: 咱们最好在下雨前出发。

en: She took in the washing when it started to rain.
zh: 开始下雨时，她把洗好的衣服收了进来。

en: Take an umbrella with you in case it begins to rain.
zh: 带把伞吧，万一下起雨来。

en: It was yesterday evening when it began to rain.
zh: 是昨天晚上开始下雨的。

en: We had not gone so far when it started to rain.
zh: 咱们还没走多远就开始下雨了。

en: It's beginning to rain. Please share my umbrella.
zh: 开始下雨了，跟我打一把伞吧。

en: It began to rain, so he need not have watered the lawn.
zh: 下起雨来了，他本来没必要给草坪浇水的。

en: It is going to rain.
zh: 要下雨了。

en: It has ceased raining.
zh: 雨停了。

en: Let's go back before it begins to rain.
zh: 趁还没下雨，咱们赶紧回去吧。

en: As it began to rain, I ran into my house.
zh: 下起雨来了，我就跑进屋了。

en: When it began to rain, she told her son to take in the washing.
zh: 开始下雨的时候，她叫儿子把洗好的衣服收进来。

en: The rain began to fall.
zh: 下起雨来了。

en: It began to rain and she got wet.
zh: 下起雨来，她被淋湿了。

en: I am afraid that it will rain.
zh: 我怕会下雨。

en: What were you doing when it began to rain?
zh: 开始下雨的时候你在干嘛呢？

en: I think it's going to rain.
zh: 我看要下雨了。

en: It is likely to rain.
zh: 很可能会下雨。

en: It looks like rain. You had better take in the washing.
zh: 看着要下雨了，你最好把衣服收了。

en: It's going to rain. Look at those dark clouds.
zh: 要下雨了，看那片乌云。

en: Unless it rains, I will go, too.
zh: 除非下雨，不然我也去。

en: But for the rain, we would have had a pleasant journey.
zh: 要不是因为下雨，我们这趟旅程本来会很愉快的。

en: The flowers in the garden died from the absence of rain.
zh: 花园里的花因为没雨水干死了。

en: Absence of rain caused the plants to die.
zh: 缺雨导致植物都枯死了。

en: Unless it rains, the game will be held on Sunday.
zh: 只要不下雨，比赛周日照常举行。

en: The festival will be held in the garden, unless it rains.
zh: 只要不下雨，庆典就在花园里举行。

en: It was raining and the game was called off.
zh: 因为下雨，比赛取消了。

en: Rain doesn't depress people who like reading.
zh: 喜欢读书的人不会因为下雨而感到郁闷。

en: The rain didn't stop them from doing their job.
zh: 下雨也没耽误他们干活。

en: It was raining, and Joe's long hair was completely wet by the time he got home.
zh: 下着雨，乔回到家时他的长发全都湿透了。

en: I don't like to go outside when it's raining.
zh: 下雨天我不想出门。

en: Avoid crossing this street when it is raining.
zh: 下雨天尽量别过这条街。

en: Seeing that it is raining, you had better stay home.
zh: 既然下着雨，你最好待在家里。

en: It will get dark earlier this evening, as it is raining.
zh: 今天下雨，天会黑得早一点。

en: It's raining, but I would like to go out.
zh: 下着雨，但我还是想出去。

en: It's raining. You might just as well stay home.
zh: 下着雨呢，你干脆就在家待着吧。

en: If it were not raining, I would go fishing.
zh: 要是不下雨，我就去钓鱼了。

en: It has been raining. The roads are wet.
zh: 一直在下雨，路上都是湿的。

en: If it is raining, I won't go out tonight.
zh: 如果下雨的话，我今晚就不出门了。

en: I stayed indoors because it rained.
zh: 因为下雨，我一直待在屋里。

en: Since it was raining, I took a taxi.
zh: 因为下雨，我就打了个车。

en: Catherine stayed indoors because it was raining.
zh: 凯瑟琳因为下雨一直待在屋里。

en: The weather being rainy, the baseball game was cancelled.
zh: 因为下雨，棒球赛取消了。

en: I took a taxi because it was raining.
zh: 因为下雨，我打了个出租车。

en: It was all the more depressing because it was raining.
zh: 因为下雨，心情变得更郁郁寡欢了。

en: Though it was raining, she went out.
zh: 虽然下着雨，她还是出门了。

en: Although it rained, everyone had a good time.
zh: 虽然下雨了，但大家玩得都很开心。

en: Though it was raining, we played football.
zh: 虽然下着雨，我们还是去踢足球了。

en: I didn't stay home because it was raining.
zh: 我并不是因为下雨才待在家里的。

en: It was raining.
zh: 当时正下着雨。

en: It was raining, but he went out.
zh: 下着雨呢，但他还是出门了。

en: The rain made the autumn day dismal.
zh: 这场雨让秋天显得格外阴郁。

en: Plants grow quickly after rain.
zh: 雨后植物长得很快。

en: I always wear boots when it rains or snows.
zh: 下雨或下雪的时候，我总是穿靴子。

en: It has been raining off and on.
zh: 这雨一直断断续续地下个不停。

en: If it rains, we will put off our practice match.
zh: 如果下雨，我们就推迟练习赛。

en: The game was called off because it rained.
zh: 比赛因为下雨取消了。

en: Since it was raining, we stayed at home.
zh: 因为下雨，我们就待在家里了。

en: The rain compelled us to put off the gathering.
zh: 这场雨逼得我们不得不推迟聚会。

en: Few were at the seaside because it was raining.
zh: 因为下雨，海边没几个人。

en: They stayed at home, because it rained.
zh: 他们待在家里，因为下雨了。

en: Since it rained, we did not go on a picnic.
zh: 因为下雨，我们没去野餐。

en: The picnic was held in the gym on account of the rain.
zh: 因为下雨，野餐改在体育馆里举行了。

en: Since it rained, I did not go.
zh: 因为下雨，我没去。

en: The rain was beating against the windows.
zh: 雨点啪嗒啪嗒地打在窗户上。

en: The rain was driving against the windows.
zh: 雨水猛烈地拍打着窗户。

en: A heavy rain began to fall.
zh: 下起大雨来了。

en: It's raining hard and yet I must go.
zh: 雨下得很大，但我还是得走。

en: It was raining hard, but she insisted on going for a drive.
zh: 雨下得很大，但她非要开车出去转转。

en: In spite of the heavy rain, he decided to go out.
zh: 尽管雨很大，他还是决定出门。

en: It rained heavily, and consequently the baseball game was called off.
zh: 雨下得很大，结果棒球赛取消了。

en: It is raining hard.
zh: 雨下得很大。

en: Rain formed pools in the hollow spaces on the rocks.
zh: 雨水在岩石的凹处积成了小水洼。

en: The rain was driving in our faces.
zh: 雨点直往我们脸上扑。

en: The rain was dripping through a leak in the roof.
zh: 雨水顺着房顶的漏点往下滴。

en: Rain dripped off the roof slowly.
zh: 雨水从房檐慢慢滴下来。

en: She advised us that it would rain all day.
zh: 她跟我们说这雨得下一整天。

en: The sky lightened as it stopped raining.
zh: 雨停了，天也亮堂了。

en: I wish the rain would stop.
zh: 真希望雨赶紧停。

en: If only the rain would stop.
zh: 要是雨能停了就好了。

en: It left off raining and we managed to finish our game of tennis.
zh: 雨停了，我们总算把网球赛打完了。

en: Let's play baseball when the rain stops.
zh: 等雨停了，咱们去打棒球吧。

en: I may go out if the rain lets up.
zh: 等雨小点儿了，我可能会出门。

en: Since it stopped raining, he went out for a walk.
zh: 既然雨停了，他就出去散步了。

en: The rain being over, they went on with the game.
zh: 雨停了之后，他们继续进行比赛。

en: Scarcely had the rain stopped before a rainbow appeared.
zh: 雨刚停，彩虹就出来了。

en: If only it would stop raining!
zh: 要是雨能停了该多好啊！

en: Wait till the rain stops.
zh: 等雨停了再说吧。

en: Let's wait for the rain to stop.
zh: 等雨停了吧。

en: We shall leave for home as soon as it stops raining.
zh: 雨一停咱们就回家。

en: If only the rain would stop!
zh: 要是雨能停就好了！

en: The rain was falling in my face.
zh: 雨水落在我脸上。

en: It is raining worse than ever.
zh: 雨下得比之前更大了。

en: It began to rain in earnest.
zh: 雨真下起来了。

en: He closed the window for fear of rain.
zh: 他怕下雨，就把窗户关上了。

en: Let's go out unless it rains.
zh: 除非下雨，不然咱们就出去。

en: It was raining hard, so we played indoors.
zh: 雨下得很大，所以我们在屋里玩。

en: It is raining heavily.
zh: 雨下得很大。

en: It was raining hard, and what is worse, the wind began to rise.
zh: 雨下得很大，更糟的是还刮起风来了。

en: It rained so hard that we decided to visit him some other time.
zh: 雨下得太大了，我们决定改天再去拜访他。

en: It began to sprinkle.
zh: 开始下毛毛雨了。

en: It was raining so hard that we had to put off our departure.
zh: 雨下得太大了，我们不得不推迟出发。

en: The rain just stopped, so let's leave.
zh: 雨刚停，咱们走吧。

en: The wild and windy night that the rain washed away.
zh: 大雨冲刷掉了那个狂风大作的夜晚。

en: I only hope that the rain holds off for a few hours more.
zh: 我只希望这雨能再晚几个小时下。

en: The rain is raining all around.
zh: 到处都在下雨。

en: When the rain stops, we'll go for a walk.
zh: 雨停了咱们去散散步。

en: It rained five days on end.
zh: 连着下了五天雨。

en: The rain lasted three days.
zh: 这雨下了三天。

en: It has been raining a full five days.
zh: 整整下了五天雨了。

en: It has been raining heavily for three hours.
zh: 大雨已经下了三个小时了。

en: Let's get home before this rain gets any stronger.
zh: 趁雨还没下大，咱们赶紧回家吧。

en: Feathers are peculiar to birds.
zh: 羽毛是鸟类特有的。

en: A crow is as black as coal.
zh: 乌鸦像煤一样黑。

en: I found a bird whose wing was severely damaged.
zh: 我发现一只翅膀伤得很重的鸟。

en: It won't be long before we can enjoy space travel.
zh: 用不了多久我们就能去太空旅游了。

en: The time will come and in it we can enjoy space travel.
zh: 总有一天我们可以去太空旅行。

en: Space travel was thought to be impossible.
zh: 太空旅行曾经被认为是不可能的。

en: Space travel is no longer a dream.
zh: 太空旅行不再是梦想了。

en: Space travel will be commonplace some time in the future.
zh: 将来有一天，太空旅行会变得很平常。

en: I wonder what it is like to travel through space.
zh: 我想知道在太空旅行是什么感觉。

en: The astronauts were greeted with cheers and applause of an enthusiastic crowd.
zh: 宇航员们受到了热烈人群的欢呼和掌声。

en: The astronauts were greeted with spontaneous applause.
zh: 宇航员们赢得了自发的掌声。

en: The astronauts went up to the moon in a rocket.
zh: 宇航员们乘火箭上了月球。

en: The astronauts were greeted by their enthusiastic cheers and applause.
zh: 宇航员们受到了他们热烈的欢呼和掌声。

en: People were delighted at the safe return of the astronauts.
zh: 看到宇航员们平安归来，人们非常高兴。

en: The spaceship is out of orbit around the moon.
zh: 宇宙飞船脱离了绕月轨道。

en: The space ship will get to the moon soon.
zh: 飞船很快就要到达月球了。

en: The spaceship made a perfect landing.
zh: 飞船完美着陆。

en: A voyage to the moon in a spaceship is no longer a dream.
zh: 坐飞船去月球旅行不再是梦想了。

en: If it is seen from a spaceship, the earth looks blue.
zh: 如果从飞船上看，地球是蓝色的。

en: Seen from a spacecraft, the earth looks blue.
zh: 从飞船上看，地球是蓝色的。

en: There is no air in space.
zh: 太空里没有空气。

en: Space science is still in its infancy.
zh: 航天科学还处于起步阶段。

en: The time has come when we can travel through space.
zh: 我们可以进行太空旅行的时代已经到来了。

en: Space is full of mystery.
zh: 太空充满了神秘。

en: The use of space must be limited to non-military purposes, as far as Japan's involvement is concerned.
zh: 就日本而言，对太空的利用必须局限于非军事目的。

en: What is the origin of the universe?
zh: 宇宙的起源是什么？

en: The origin of the universe will probably never be explained.
zh: 宇宙的起源可能永远也解释不清楚。

en: I am seeking the path to the end of the universe.
zh: 我在寻找通往宇宙尽头的路。

en: I am invited to the end of the universe.
zh: 我被邀请去宇宙的尽头。

en: There are countless heavenly bodies in space.
zh: 太空里有无数的天体。

en: There are innumerable stars in the universe.
zh: 宇宙里有数不清的星星。

en: There is no limit to the universe.
zh: 宇宙是无穷无尽的。

en: There are millions of stars in the universe.
zh: 宇宙里有几百万颗恒星。

en: There are many galaxies in the universe.
zh: 宇宙里有很多星系。

en: Seen from space, the earth is very beautiful.
zh: 从太空看，地球非常漂亮。

en: I can't stretch my right arm.
zh: 我右胳膊伸不直。

en: I can't lift my right arm.
zh: 我右胳膊抬不起来。

en: I think my right arm is broken.
zh: 我觉得我右胳膊骨折了。

en: I can't bend my right arm.
zh: 我右胳膊弯不了。

en: I'm afraid I dislocated my right arm.
zh: 我担心我右胳膊脱臼了。

en: I'm afraid I have a crack in my right arm.
zh: 我担心我右胳膊骨裂了。

en: I can't see anything with my right eye.
zh: 我右眼什么也看不见。

en: My right eye feels hot.
zh: 我右眼发烫。

en: Something has happened to my right eye.
zh: 我右眼出问题了。

en: My right foot is sleeping.
zh: 我右脚麻了。

en: You should keep to the right.
zh: 你应该靠右走。

en: The building on the right side is a school.
zh: 右边那个建筑是个学校。

en: Don't bite on the right side.
zh: 别用右边咬。

en: Turn to the right, and you'll find my office.
zh: 往右一拐，就能看到我的办公室了。

en: My upper right wisdom tooth hurts.
zh: 我右上边的智齿疼。

en: Raise your right hand.
zh: 举起你的右手。

en: I could see the rippling waves on my right.
zh: 我能看到右边泛起的波纹。

en: You can see the sea on your right.
zh: 你在右边就能看到大海。

en: My right hand is numb.
zh: 我右手麻了。

en: Pus is coming out of my right ear.
zh: 我右耳在流脓。

en: I have a corn on my right foot.
zh: 我右脚长了个鸡眼。

en: Turn to the right.
zh: 往右转。

en: Lie on your right side.
zh: 往右侧躺。

en: Turning to the right, you will find the city hall in front of you.
zh: 往右拐，市政厅就在你正前方。

en: Turning to the right, you will find the hospital.
zh: 往右一拐就是医院。

en: Turning to the right, you will see a white tower.
zh: 往右转，你会看到一座白塔。

en: There's a pea in my right nostril.
zh: 我右鼻孔里有个豆子。

en: Take the road on the right.
zh: 走右边那条路。

en: Take the right road.
zh: 走右边的路。

en: Roll up your right sleeve.
zh: 把你右边的袖子卷起来。

en: You have your right sock on wrong side out.
zh: 你右脚的袜子穿反了。

en: If you turn right, you will see a big building.
zh: 往右拐，你就能看到一栋大楼。

en: Turning to the right, you will come to the museum.
zh: 往右拐就到博物馆了。

en: Turning right, you'll find the hospital on your left.
zh: 往右转，你会发现医院就在你左边。

en: Turn to the right, and you'll find the hotel.
zh: 往右一拐，你就能找到酒店。

en: Right and left are opposites.
zh: 左右是相反的。

en: Always give way to traffic coming from the right.
zh: 始终要给右侧来车让路。

en: OK, now turn to your right, a little further, a little further... good. Now lie still on your back.
zh: 好了，现在往右转，再过来一点，再一点……好。现在平躺着别动。

en: The hermit lived in a wooden hut.
zh: 那个隐士住在一个木屋里。

en: Secret gifts are openly rewarded.
zh: 默默的付出终会得到回报。

en: Don't hold back anything.
zh: 别藏着掖着。

en: You are a snake!
zh: 你真是条毒蛇！

en: Nobody likes being spoken ill of behind his back.
zh: 没人喜欢被人在背后说坏话。

en: Don't speak badly of him in his absence.
zh: 别在背后说他坏话。

en: You should not speak ill of others behind their backs.
zh: 你不应该在背后说别人的坏话。

en: You should not speak of others behind their backs.
zh: 你不该在背后议论别人。

en: Don't speak ill of others behind their back.
zh: 别在背后说人家坏话。

en: You shouldn't talk about people behind their backs.
zh: 你不应该在背后议论人家。

en: Acid rain in drinking water affects human health.
zh: 饮用水里的酸雨会影响人体健康。

en: Would you care for a drink?
zh: 要喝点儿什么吗？

en: Is there a drink minimum?
zh: 这里有最低消费吗？

en: Drinking and driving can be dangerous.
zh: 酒驾很危险。

en: Driving after drinking alcohol is not acceptable behavior.
zh: 酒后开车是绝对不行的。

en: If you're drunk don't take the wheel of a car.
zh: 喝醉了就别开车。

en: The more you drink, the less careful you will be.
zh: 你喝得越多，就越不小心。

en: I'll explain how to take this medicine.
zh: 我来告诉你这药怎么吃。

en: I would like to order drinks now.
zh: 我现在想点喝的。

en: Help yourself to a drink.
zh: 想喝什么自己拿。

en: May I offer you a drink?
zh: 喝点什么吗？

en: I'll fix a drink.
zh: 我去弄杯喝的。

en: Will you give me a drink?
zh: 能给我弄点喝的吗？

en: Are drinks free?
zh: 饮料免费吗？

en: The drinks looked cool and delicious.
zh: 饮料看着又凉快又好喝。

en: The drinks were served in coconut shells.
zh: 饮料是用椰子壳装的。

en: Please help yourselves to the drinks.
zh: 大家想喝什么随便拿。

en: I'm going to make a drink.
zh: 我去弄点喝的。

en: Mr. Mitsubishi is drinking at home to save his drinking money.
zh: 三菱先生为了省酒钱都在家里喝。

en: Let's get you fixed up with a drink.
zh: 给你弄杯喝的吧。

en: Each individual paid 7000 dollars.
zh: 每人付了七千块钱。

en: Have a good supply of drinking water.
zh: 准备好足够的饮用水。

en: He doesn't care, provided he has enough to eat and drink.
zh: 只要有吃的喝的，他什么都不在乎。

en: One can drink too much, but one never drinks enough.
zh: 一个人可能会喝多，但永远不会喝够。

en: Too much drinking will make your life a ruin.
zh: 酗酒会毁了你的一生。

en: The room started to spin after I drank too much.
zh: 喝多了以后，我感觉屋子都在转。

en: I drank too much and the ground seemed to spin under my feet.
zh: 我喝多了，感觉地都在脚下转。

en: I drank too much. My face is swollen!
zh: 我喝多了，脸都肿了！

en: I got along so well with the guy sitting next to me at the pub that we ended up drinking together till dawn.
zh: 我在酒吧和旁边那哥们儿聊得特别投缘，结果俩人一直喝到了天亮。

en: You will ruin your health if you drink too much.
zh: 酒喝多了会搞垮身体的。

en: Don't risk your health by over drinking.
zh: 别拿身体开玩笑，少喝点酒。

en: Too much alcohol may result in gastric disease.
zh: 饮酒过量会导致胃病。

en: I was made to drink.
zh: 我是被逼着喝酒的。

en: Gravity acts on everything in the universe.
zh: 引力作用于宇宙中的万物。

en: Gravity causes objects to have weight.
zh: 重力让物体有了重量。

en: Gravity is the natural force by which objects are attracted to each other.
zh: 万有引力是物体之间相互吸引的自然力量。

en: Gravity binds the planets to the sun.
zh: 引力把行星束缚在太阳周围。

en: Without gravity we would be hurled off into space.
zh: 要是没有引力，我们会被甩进太空。

en: When I retire, I'd like to spend the rest of my life in the country.
zh: 我退休以后想在乡下度过余生。

en: The drawer won't open.
zh: 抽屉拉不开了。

en: Empty the drawer of its contents.
zh: 把抽屉里的东西都拿出来。

en: We're going to pull it.
zh: 我们要拉它。

en: Can you help me when I move?
zh: 我搬家的时候你能帮帮我吗？

en: Could you help me when I move?
zh: 我搬家的时候你能帮下忙吗？

en: She didn't like this city when she moved here, but she has gotten used to it now.
zh: 她刚搬到这儿的时候不太喜欢这个城市，但现在已经习惯了。

en: You have to pull that door to open it.
zh: 那扇门得往外拉才能打开。

en: Let's turn back.
zh: 咱们往回走吧。

en: I will continue with my efforts.
zh: 我会继续努力的。

en: We appreciate your continued support.
zh: 感谢您一直以来的支持。

en: When will they have that picture ready that I wanted to get blown up?
zh: 我想扩印的那张照片什么时候能弄好？

en: Give me a hoist.
zh: 托我一把。

en: The drawer is stuffed full of odds and ends.
zh: 抽屉里塞满了零碎东西。

en: The lock on my drawer had been tampered with and some of my papers were missing.
zh: 我抽屉的锁被动过，几份文件不见了。

en: I forgot to lock the drawer.
zh: 我忘了锁抽屉。

en: It is no use your holding me back.
zh: 你拦着我也没用。

en: May I see your claim tags?
zh: 我可以看下您的行李票吗？

en: Don't pull it. Push it open.
zh: 别拉，推开。

en: I persuaded him to give up the idea.
zh: 我说服他放弃了那个念头。

en: When was printing invented?
zh: 印刷术是什么时候发明的？

en: Mistakes in the printing should be pointed out at once.
zh: 印刷上的错误应该立刻指出来。

en: Many typographical errors were found.
zh: 发现了不少排版错误。

en: Printing ink is in short supply.
zh: 印刷油墨短缺。

en: Lightning precedes thunder.
zh: 闪电在打雷之前。

en: Lightning is usually followed by thunder.
zh: 闪电过后通常会打雷。

en: Lightning can be dangerous.
zh: 闪电可能很危险。

en: Lightning is an electrical phenomenon.
zh: 闪电是一种放电现象。

en: Lightning lit up the room every now and then.
zh: 闪电时不时地照亮房间。

en: The dog hid under the bed whenever lightning flashed.
zh: 每次一打闪，那只狗就钻到床底下。

en: After the lightning, came the thunder.
zh: 闪电过后就是雷声。

en: The lightning flashed.
zh: 刚才打闪了。

en: The flash of lightning precedes the sound of thunder.
zh: 闪电出现在雷声之前。

en: Rice is grown in rainy regions.
zh: 水稻种在多雨的地区。

en: A festival is held at the rice harvest.
zh: 稻子收割时会举行庆典。

en: The rice crop is already in.
zh: 稻子已经收割完了。

en: Ichiro puts friendship above profit.
zh: 一郎看重友情胜过利益。

en: Ichiro will go to Nagoya for the first time.
zh: 一郎要第一次去名古屋了。

en: The chain of crimes are thought to have been committed by the same man.
zh: 这一连串案子被认为是同一个人干的。

en: A series of blasts reduced the laboratory to ruins.
zh: 一连串爆炸把实验室炸成了废墟。

en: A chain of events led to the outbreak of the war.
zh: 一连串事件导致了战争的爆发。

en: A row of old houses is being destroyed to make way for new flats.
zh: 一排老房子正被拆除，要改建新公寓。

en: Please line up in a row.
zh: 请排成一排。

en: The first baseman tagged the runner out.
zh: 一垒手将跑者触杀出局。

en: An illustration may make the point clear.
zh: 配个插图可能就讲清楚了。

en: A unicycle has only one wheel.
zh: 独轮车只有一个轮子。

en: He added that he was coming up to town in a day or two.
zh: 他补充说他这一两天就进城。

en: I'll let you know in a day or so.
zh: 我过一两天告诉你。

en: I'll give you an answer in a day or two.
zh: 我这一两天给你答复。

en: Please book me a room in a first-class hotel.
zh: 请帮我订一间高档酒店的房间。

en: That's a class act.
zh: 那做得真漂亮。

en: I delivered identical twins.
zh: 我接生了一对同卵双胞胎。

en: I suppose I'll be in trouble if I don't stay up all night to cram for the examination.
zh: 我看如果不熬通宵临时抱佛脚的话，考试就麻烦了。

en: At a glance, he knew that the child was hungry.
zh: 他一眼就看出孩子饿了。

en: At a glance I knew that he was tired.
zh: 我一眼就看出他累了。

en: I recognized Mr Jones at first glance.
zh: 我一眼就认出了琼斯先生。

en: She attracted me at first sight.
zh: 她第一眼就把我迷住了。

en: I recognized her at first glance.
zh: 我一眼就认出她来了。

en: Can you lend me 10,000 yen?
zh: 能借我一万日元吗？

en: Can you break a 10,000 yen bill?
zh: 能帮我把这一万日元换开吗？

en: An arrow passed through the hawk.
zh: 一支箭射穿了那只老鹰。

en: He took out a piece of chalk.
zh: 他拿出一支粉笔。

en: A tall tree projects its long shadow on the water.
zh: 一棵大树在水面上投下了长长的影子。

en: One is tall and the other is short.
zh: 一个高，一个矮。

en: I know one of them but not the other.
zh: 我认识其中一个，但不认识另一个。

en: One is red and the other is white.
zh: 一个是红色的，另一个是白色的。

en: One book is thin. The other is thick. The thick one has about 200 pages.
zh: 一本书很薄，另一本很厚。厚的那本大约有两百页。

en: What's sauce for the goose is sauce for the gander.
zh: 对谁都应该一视同仁。

en: On the one hand he is kind to everyone, but on the other hand he never behaves with too much familiarity.
zh: 一方面他待人很亲切，但另一方面他举止很有分寸，从不过分亲密。

en: On one hand he praised my report, but on the other hand he criticized it.
zh: 他一方面夸奖了我的报告，另一方面又提出了批评。

en: On the one hand we suffered a heavy loss, but on the other hand we learned a great deal from the experience.
zh: 一方面我们损失惨重，但另一方面我们也从中学到了很多经验。

en: On one hand he is kind, but on the other hand he is lazy.
zh: 他一方面很善良，但另一方面又很懒。

en: On the one hand, you are wrong, but on the other hand, I can't blame you for that.
zh: 一方面是你不对，但另一方面我也不能因此怪你。

en: Americans, on the other hand, are more likely to take chances in the hope of achieving great success.
zh: 相比之下，美国人更倾向于为了获得成功而冒险。

en: The first step is as good as half over.
zh: 良好的开端是成功的一半。

en: One step further, and you will fall into an abyss.
zh: 再往前走一步，你就会掉进深渊。

en: You must learn step by step.
zh: 你得一步步来。

en: If you move a step, and you will be a dead man.
zh: 你敢动一步，就死定了。

en: Move a step, and you'll be a dead man!
zh: 敢动一下，你就死定了！

en: A single step, and you will fall over the cliff.
zh: 只要走错一步，你就会摔下悬崖。

en: Penny wise, pound foolish.
zh: 因小失大。

en: Penny-wise and pound-foolish.
zh: 贪小便宜吃大亏。

en: A minute has sixty seconds.
zh: 一分钟有六十秒。

en: What do you say to taking a rest?
zh: 歇会儿怎么样？

en: How about a smoke?
zh: 抽根烟怎么样？

en: Give me chapter and verse.
zh: 给我详详细细地说明白。

en: I partly agree with you.
zh: 我部分同意你的看法。

en: Some hospitals hand out free samples of baby milk.
zh: 有些医院会派发免费的婴儿奶粉样品。

en: Some college teachers come to class late and leave early.
zh: 有些大学老师上课总是迟到早退。

en: Some babies learn to swim even before they are one year old.
zh: 有些宝宝还不到一岁就学会游泳了。

en: Some people believe that Japan is No.1 in everything.
zh: 有些人觉得日本在各方面都是第一。

en: Some newspapers distorted the news.
zh: 一些报纸歪曲了新闻。

en: Some Blacks seek more radical solutions.
zh: 一些黑人寻求更激进的解决办法。

en: A second is a sixtieth part of a minute.
zh: 一秒是一分钟的六十分之一。

en: A cat ran across the street.
zh: 一只猫跑过了马路。

en: One dog and two people are jumping.
zh: 一只狗和两个人在跳。

en: I got up early in order to catch the first train.
zh: 我起得很早，为了赶上头班车。

en: I walked quickly so that I might catch the first train.
zh: 我走得很快，好赶上头班车。

en: The best thing to do is to ask an expert to repair it.
zh: 最好的办法是请个专家来修。

en: Charles always takes the line of least resistance.
zh: 查尔斯总是挑最省事的路走。

en: The youngest boy dropped behind the other hikers.
zh: 最小的那个男孩落在了其他徒步者的后面。

en: The greatest number came from Europe, but many also came from Latin America, Asia, Africa, Australia, and Canada.
zh: 绝大多数人来自欧洲，但也有不少来自拉美、亚洲、非洲、澳大利亚和加拿大。

en: The boy who writes best wins the prize.
zh: 谁字写得最好，谁就得奖。

en: The eldest sister acted for the mother.
zh: 大姐履行了母亲的职责。

en: Which is the hottest of all the seasons?
zh: 哪个季节最热？

en: I always read the sports page first.
zh: 我总是先看体育版。

en: How much is the most expensive car?
zh: 最贵的车多少钱？

en: The most expensive thing is land.
zh: 最贵的东西是土地。

en: Where is the nearest telephone box?
zh: 最近的公用电话亭在哪儿？

en: Where's the nearest travel agency?
zh: 最近的旅行社在哪儿？

en: Where's the nearest drugstore?
zh: 最近的药店在哪儿？

en: Where's the nearest museum?
zh: 最近的博物馆在哪儿？

en: Can you tell me where the nearest zoo is?
zh: 你能告诉我最近的动物园在哪儿吗？

en: Where's the nearest library?
zh: 最近的图书馆在哪儿？

en: Can you tell me where the nearest pay phone is?
zh: 你能告诉我最近的投币电话在哪儿吗？

en: Where is the nearest bank?
zh: 最近的银行在哪儿？

en: Can you tell me where the nearest church is?
zh: 你能告诉我最近的教堂在哪儿吗？

en: Where's the nearest church?
zh: 最近的教堂在哪儿？

en: Can you tell me where the nearest courtesy phone is?
zh: 你能告诉我最近的服务电话在哪儿吗？

en: Where's the nearest art gallery?
zh: 最近的美术馆在哪儿？

en: Where is the nearest lost and found?
zh: 最近的失物招领处在哪儿？

en: Can you tell me where the nearest hotel service phone is?
zh: 你能告诉我最近的酒店服务电话在哪儿吗？

en: Can you tell me where the nearest bus stop is?
zh: 你能告诉我最近的公交站在哪儿吗？

en: Where's the nearest department store?
zh: 最近的百货商场在哪儿？

en: Where's the nearest shopping mall?
zh: 最近的购物中心在哪儿？

en: Can you tell me where the nearest antique shop is?
zh: 你能告诉我最近的古董店在哪儿吗？

en: Where is nearest American Express office?
zh: 最近的美国运通办事处在哪儿？

en: Do you know where the nearest American Express office is?
zh: 你知道最近的美国运通办事处在哪儿吗？

en: I'd like to know the phone number of the nearest American Express office.
zh: 我想知道最近的美国运通办事处的电话号码。

en: I was beside myself with jealousy when my youngest sister rose in the world.
zh: 我小妹出人头地的时候，我嫉妒疯了。

en: My youngest brother was brought up by our grandmother.
zh: 我最小的弟弟是奶奶带大的。

en: The youngest child spent every morning at a nursery.
zh: 最小的孩子每天上午都在托儿所。

en: The rightmost lane is now under construction.
zh: 最右边的车道正在施工。

en: I'd like the most inexpensive room you have for four nights.
zh: 我想要你们这最便宜的房间，住四个晚上。

en: I'd like to rent your most inexpensive car for a week.
zh: 我想租你们这最便宜的车，租一个星期。

en: It's always cheaper in the end to buy the best.
zh: 买最好的最后其实更省钱。

en: What is most troublesome is the corruption of the best.
zh: 最让人头疼的是最好的东西变质了。

en: The best thing is to telephone her.
zh: 最好给她打个电话。

en: The best thing would be for you to do the work yourself.
zh: 最好是你自己亲手做这活儿。

en: You can hear English on Channel 1, and Japanese on Channel 7.
zh: 1频道是英语节目，7频道是日语节目。

en: You will feel better after a night's sleep.
zh: 睡一觉你就会觉得好多了。

en: We can accommodate him for the night.
zh: 我们可以留他住一晚。

en: I'll fix you up for the night.
zh: 我来安排你住一晚。

en: It was blowing hard all night.
zh: 刮了一整夜的大风。

en: We would often sit up all night discussing politics.
zh: 我们以前经常通宵聊政治。

en: I was roaming over the mountains all through the night.
zh: 我一整夜都在山里游荡。

en: I felt cold and uneasy all night.
zh: 我整晚都觉得又冷又不踏实。

en: It was raining on and off all night long.
zh: 雨断断续续下了一整夜。

en: After drinking all night, Bob was dead to the world.
zh: 喝了一宿酒，鲍勃现在睡得跟死猪一样。

en: The clothes soaked in water overnight were heavy.
zh: 泡了一夜水的衣服很沉。

en: Will you put us up for one night?
zh: 你能让我们借住一晚吗？

en: I wonder whether man could live with only two hours' sleep a night.
zh: 我在想人如果每晚只睡两个小时能不能活。

en: I read the whole book in one evening.
zh: 我一个晚上就把整本书看完了。

en: He looked refreshed after a good night's sleep.
zh: 睡了个好觉，他看起来精神多了。

en: General admission is $7 for adults.
zh: 成人普通票是7美元。

en: In general, little girls are fond of dolls.
zh: 一般来说，小女孩都很喜欢洋娃娃。

en: Generally speaking, Japanese cars are popular overseas.
zh: 总的来说，日本车在国外挺受欢迎的。

en: Generally speaking, the weather was mild last year.
zh: 总的来说，去年的天气挺温和的。

en: Generally speaking, savings are increasing.
zh: 普遍来看，储蓄金额一直在增加。

en: Generally speaking, the climate in England is mild.
zh: 一般来说，英国的气候挺温和的。

en: Generally speaking, children like to play outdoors.
zh: 一般来说，小孩都喜欢在户外玩。

en: Generally speaking, high school students study harder than college students.
zh: 一般来说，高中生学习比大学生更刻苦。

en: Generally speaking, there is little rain here in June.
zh: 一般来说，这儿六月份雨水不多。

en: The people in this town, generally speaking, are kind to visitors.
zh: 这个镇上的人普遍对游客很友好。

en: Generally, Japanese people are shy.
zh: 一般来说，日本人比较腼腆。

en: Generally speaking, orchestra conductors wear tailcoats at concerts.
zh: 一般来说，交响乐指挥在音乐会上都会穿燕尾服。

en: Generally speaking, a waiter in Japan gives good service.
zh: 一般来说，日本服务员的服务都挺周到的。

en: Generally speaking, New Zealanders are taller than Japanese.
zh: 一般来说，新西兰人比日本人个头高。

en: Generally speaking, Japanese women are modest.
zh: 一般来说，日本女性挺谦逊的。

en: Generally speaking, men are taller than women.
zh: 一般来说，男人比女人高。

en: Generally speaking, a woman will live longer than a man.
zh: 一般来说，女性的寿命比男性长。

en: Generally speaking, Westerners don't eat fish raw.
zh: 一般来说，西方人不怎么吃生鱼。

en: Generally speaking, little girls are fond of dolls.
zh: 一般来说，小女孩都挺喜欢洋娃娃的。

en: Generally speaking, women live longer than men by almost ten years.
zh: 一般来说，女性比男性要多活快十年。

en: Generally speaking, Americans like coffee.
zh: 一般来说，美国人挺喜欢喝咖啡的。

en: Generally speaking, the Japanese are hard workers.
zh: 一般来说，日本人工作都很卖力。

en: Generally speaking, the Japanese people are diligent.
zh: 一般来说，日本人都很勤奋。

en: Generally speaking, men can run faster than women can.
zh: 一般来说，男人跑得比女人快。

en: Admittedly, models of hegemonic order cannot provide an explanation for all observed successful bargaining strategies.
zh: 不可否认，霸权秩序模型没法解释所有成功的谈判策略。

en: The English people in general, are extremely fond of their pets.
zh: 英国人普遍都特别喜欢宠物。

en: Generally speaking, history repeats itself.
zh: 一般来说，历史总是会重演的。

en: Generally speaking, boys like girls with long hair.
zh: 一般来说，男孩子喜欢长头发的女生。

en: Generally speaking, men are physically stronger than women.
zh: 一般来说，男人的体力比女人强。

en: Generally speaking, the young people of today are clever.
zh: 一般来说，现在的年轻人都挺聪明的。

en: In general, consumers prefer quantity to quality.
zh: 一般来说，消费者比起质量更看重数量。

en: Generally speaking, the Englishman is not curious about others.
zh: 一般来说，英国人对别人的私事儿不怎么好奇。

en: The people at large are against war.
zh: 民众普遍反对战争。

en: The public is the best judge.
zh: 群众的眼睛是雪亮的。

en: The public at large are dissatisfied with the present government.
zh: 广大民众对现在的政府挺不满的。

en: The public is entitled to information about how public money is spent.
zh: 公众有权知道公款是怎么花的。

en: In order to elude her eager public, the movie star checked into the hotel under a false name.
zh: 为了躲开狂热的影迷，那位电影明星用假名登记入住酒店。

en: The general feeling is that it's wrong.
zh: 大家普遍觉得这么做不对。

en: Does he have general common sense?
zh: 他有基本的常识吗？

en: The general opinion is against the war.
zh: 舆论普遍反对战争。

en: The people at large were against the war.
zh: 当时民众普遍反对那场战争。

en: The people at large are hoping for great changes in the light of the present situation.
zh: 考虑到现在的状况，大众都盼着能有大变革。

en: In general, Japanese are hardworking.
zh: 一般来说，日本人都挺勤劳的。

en: The Japanese at large consider themselves better off than they used to be.
zh: 大多数日本人都觉得现在的日子比以前好过了。

en: Boys, as a rule, are taller than girls.
zh: 一般来说，男孩子比女孩子个头高。

en: People in general are against the new law.
zh: 大家普遍反对这项新法律。

en: In general, young people dislike formality.
zh: 总的来说，年轻人都不太喜欢繁文缛节。

en: The weather this week has been good on the whole.
zh: 这周天气整体来说还不错。

en: In general, young people today are not interested in politics.
zh: 总的来说，现在的年轻人对政治不怎么感兴趣。

en: In general, it may be said that he is a genius in music.
zh: 总的来说，可以说他是个音乐天才。

en: In general, communication between doctors and their patients is the most important part of medical treatment.
zh: 总的来说，医生和病人之间的沟通是治疗中最重要的部分。

en: In general, people in America tend to prefer bigger cars.
zh: 一般来说，美国人更喜欢大一点的车。

en: We'd like a deposit for one night.
zh: 我们要收一晚上的押金。

en: What's the daily rate?
zh: 一天的房费是多少？

en: Would you join me in a drink?
zh: 要不要一起喝一杯？

en: I wouldn't mind a drink.
zh: 我倒是不介意喝点儿。

en: I feel like a drink.
zh: 我想喝点儿。

en: I feel like having a drink.
zh: 我想喝一杯。

en: Please give me a cup of milk.
zh: 请给我来杯牛奶。

en: A cup of coffee cleared my head.
zh: 喝了杯咖啡，我头脑清醒多了。

en: How about a drink?
zh: 喝一杯怎么样？

en: Can I buy you a drink?
zh: 我请你喝一杯吧？

en: Give me a shot.
zh: 给我来一小杯烈酒。

en: I'll buy you a drink.
zh: 我请你喝一杯。

en: Let me buy you a drink.
zh: 我请你喝一杯吧。

en: Want a drink?
zh: 想喝点儿吗？

en: After a year's practice, she plays the piano after a fashion.
zh: 练了一年，她弹得也就勉勉强强。

en: I'm going to give you a year's worth of allowance all at once.
zh: 我打算把一年的零花钱一次性都给你。

en: They have much rain all the year round.
zh: 他们那儿一年到头总下雨。

en: It's the best season of the year.
zh: 这是一年里最好的季节。

en: It was the same all year round.
zh: 一年到头都是那个样。

en: I was here about a year ago.
zh: 我大约一年前来过这儿。

en: Who said you can swagger around like that just because you're one year ahead of me?
zh: 谁说你比我早来一年就能这么嚣张？

en: No one can determine the amount of money we waste in a year.
zh: 谁也说不清咱们一年到底浪费了多少钱。

en: It is impossible to master English in a year or so.
zh: 想在一年左右就把英语学精是不可能的。

en: The first month of the year is January.
zh: 一年的第一个月是一月份。

en: New Year's Day is the key to the year.
zh: 元旦定下了这一年的基调。

en: We have a lot of snow at this time of the year.
zh: 每年这个时候我们这儿雪都挺大的。

en: There are four seasons in a year.
zh: 一年有四季。

en: Can you pay off your loans in a year?
zh: 你能在一年之内把贷款还清吗？

en: I only missed one day of work because of a cold and my desk is piled high with papers.
zh: 我就感冒休了一天假，桌上的文件就堆成山了。

en: I'm worn out, because I've been standing all day.
zh: 我累坏了，站了一整天。

en: You can't stay in here all day.
zh: 你不能整天窝在这儿。

en: I walked around all day, and I am all in.
zh: 我走了一整天，累得够呛。

en: Having worked on the farm all day long, he was completely tired out.
zh: 在地里干了一整天活，他累坏了。

en: There is nothing like a glass of beer after a whole day's work.
zh: 忙活了一整天，没什么比来杯啤酒更爽的了。

en: It rained heavily all day, during which time I stayed indoors.
zh: 雨下了一整天，我一直待在屋里没出去。

en: After waiting all day, the workers were still looking for a break in the weather so they could resume the search.
zh: 等了一整天，工人们还在等天气转好，好继续搜救。

en: It was fine all day.
zh: 一整天天气都不错。

en: We are worn out, because we have been uniting all day.
zh: 我们累坏了，因为大家聚在一起忙了一整天。

en: We enjoyed ourselves at the seaside all day.
zh: 我们在海边痛痛快快地玩了一整天。

en: It is not good for your health to shut yourself in all day.
zh: 整天憋在屋里对身体不好。

en: She hears English all through the day.
zh: 她一整天都在听英语。

en: It rained continuously all day.
zh: 雨下了一整天就没停过。

en: It rained hard all day.
zh: 大雨下了一整天。

en: I had to stay in bed all day.
zh: 我不得不在床上躺了一整天。

en: It can't be good sitting in the sun all day.
zh: 在太阳底下晒一整天可没啥好处。

en: I sit in front of a computer screen all day, so I get pretty heavily bombarded by electro-magnetic waves.
zh: 我整天盯着电脑屏幕，辐射可大了。

en: Do not stay away from English, even for a day.
zh: 哪怕只有一天，也别把英语放下。

en: Any goods can be supplied at a day's notice.
zh: 所有的货提前一天说就能准备好。

en: I couldn't wait to get my hands on one of those iBooks and now I got one as a present. I feel so lucky!
zh: 我早就想弄台 iBook 了，结果有人送了我一台。我运气也太好了！

en: Take this medicine three times a day.
zh: 这个药一天吃三次。

en: Do you mind if I take a day off?
zh: 我请一天假，你介意吗？

en: Can you get a day off?
zh: 你能请到假吗？

en: It is getting colder and colder day by day.
zh: 天一天比一天冷了。

en: Every day of thy life is a page in thy history.
zh: 你生命里的每一天都是历史的一页。

en: I always feel good after I do my good deed for the day.
zh: 每天做件好事，我感觉挺不错的。

en: After a hard day's work, a man can do with a good, hot meal.
zh: 累了一天，就想吃顿热乎饭。

en: A shit a day keeps the doctor away.
zh: 每天一泡屎，医生远离我。

en: The length of a day or a year varies but little.
zh: 一天或一年的长度几乎没什么变化。

en: A day has twenty-four hours.
zh: 一天有24小时。

en: The day is almost over.
zh: 这一天快过完了。

en: I spent the best part of the day in reading.
zh: 我大半天都在看书。

en: At the end of a working day, everybody is in a hurry to get home.
zh: 下班时间一到，大家都急着回家。

en: Do you offer any all-day tours?
zh: 你们有一日游吗？

en: In no country other than England, it has been said, can one experience four seasons in the course of a single day.
zh: 据说除了英国，没哪个国家能在一天之内让人体验到四季。

en: You should brush your teeth at least twice a day.
zh: 你每天起码得刷两次牙。

en: We have six lessons a day.
zh: 我们每天有六节课。

en: It is difficult to walk 60 kilometers a day.
zh: 一天走60公里挺难的。

en: Hardly a day passes that I don't think of you.
zh: 我几乎每天都会想起你。

en: It is next to impossible for you to finish the work in a day.
zh: 你想在一天内做完这活儿几乎不可能。

en: I find it difficult to do all this work in a day.
zh: 我觉得一天做完这些活儿挺难的。

en: I've spent $500 a day.
zh: 我一天花过500美金。

en: Not even a day can we live without water.
zh: 我们一天也离不开水。

en: I want to be quiet after a day's hard work.
zh: 忙了一整天，我想清静一下。

en: I think it's going to be a nice day.
zh: 我看今天天气会不错。

en: We'll finish it if it takes us all day.
zh: 就算要干上一整天，我们也要把它干完。

en: We can make a day of it.
zh: 我们可以玩上一整天。

en: Out of the frying pan and into the fire.
zh: 刚跳出火坑，又掉进火炉。

en: No sooner had we finished working on one tough problem than the president sent us yet another straight from the top.
zh: 我们刚解决一个难题，老板又直接丢给我们一个。

en: On behalf of the company, I welcome you.
zh: 我代表公司欢迎你。

en: The first prize may be won by him.
zh: 他可能会得一等奖。

en: I know that if we discuss it, we can find a solution that will satisfy both of us.
zh: 我知道只要咱们商量一下，就能找到个让大家都满意的办法。

en: Once you have made a promise, you should keep it.
zh: 既然答应了，就得守信用。

en: A stone once cast, and a word once spoken, cannot be recalled.
zh: 一言既出，驷马难追。

en: I remember seeing her once on the street.
zh: 我记得在街上见过她一次。

en: I'd like to have a good talk with her.
zh: 我想跟她好好聊聊。

en: Please try one.
zh: 请试一个吧。

en: Once across the river, you are safe.
zh: 只要过了河，你就安全了。

en: Once a habit has been acquired, it has almost compulsive power over us.
zh: 习惯一旦养成，就很难改掉了。

en: Once lost, time cannot be recalled.
zh: 时间一去不复返。

en: It is not too much to say that time once lost can never be recovered.
zh: 可以说，浪费的时间是补不回来的。

en: Once gone, you will never get it back.
zh: 一旦错过，就再也找不回来了。

en: Once we've killed, we enjoy killing.
zh: 一旦开了杀戒，就会杀上瘾。

en: Once you have decided to do something, stick to it.
zh: 既然决定做了，就得坚持到底。

en: Give a dog a bad name and hang him.
zh: 欲加之罪，何患无辞。

en: Are you sure you've never met him?
zh: 你确定从没见过他吗？

en: I haven't met him even once.
zh: 我一次也没见过他。

en: Don't attempt two things at a time.
zh: 别一心二用。

en: Don't attempt two projects at a time.
zh: 不要同时做两个项目。

en: Don't try to do two things at a time.
zh: 别想一次做两件事。

en: I can't do two things at a time.
zh: 我没法一心二用。

en: Learn a little at a time.
zh: 一点一点地学。

en: Take three at a time.
zh: 一次拿三个。

en: How many books can I take out at one time?
zh: 我一次能借几本书？

en: Do one thing at a time.
zh: 一次只做一件事。

en: You can't just do one thing at a time.
zh: 你不能一次只做一件事。

en: Try to do one thing at a time.
zh: 尽量一次只做一件事。

en: You must not eat too much food at one time.
zh: 你不能一次吃太多东西。

en: Too many irons in the fire result in bad workmanship.
zh: 贪多嚼不烂。

en: I think I try to do too much at a time.
zh: 我觉得我一次想做的事情太多了。

en: I cannot answer so many questions at a time.
zh: 我没法一次回答这么多问题。

en: When one has too many irons in the fire, he doesn't know where to start working.
zh: 手头事情太多，反倒不知道该从哪儿下手了。

en: We can prepare to offer you a special discount of 5% for the STL#3456, on condition that you place an order for more than 15 at one time.
zh: 只要您一次订购15个以上STL#3456，我们可以给您九五折优惠。

en: If at first you don't succeed, try, try, try again.
zh: 失败了别灰心，多试几次。

en: I wish for once I could be something.
zh: 我真希望我也能有点出息。

en: What's done cannot be undone.
zh: 覆水难收。

en: Once you leave here, you can't come back again.
zh: 你一旦离开这儿，就回不来了。

en: Please return one set to us with your signature.
zh: 请签好字后寄回一份给我们。

en: Rome was not built in a day.
zh: 罗马不是一天建成的。

en: Let's close ranks and do something new.
zh: 咱们团结起来干点新鲜的吧。

en: A group of gangsters stole money.
zh: 一伙歹徒偷了钱。

en: A car passed by at top speed.
zh: 一辆车飞驰而过。

en: A car drew up in front of my house.
zh: 一辆车在我家门口停了下来。

en: What is he mad at, I wonder?
zh: 我在想，他到底在生什么气呢？

en: Can his story be true?
zh: 他的话能是真的吗？

en: Who ever can it be?
zh: 到底能是谁呢？

en: What on earth is the problem?
zh: 到底出什么问题了？

en: Who's going to clear up all this mess?
zh: 这烂摊子谁来收拾？

en: Whoever told you such a ridiculous story?
zh: 到底是谁跟你说这么荒唐的事的？

en: What on earth are you doing here?
zh: 你到底在这儿干嘛呢？

en: Why on earth are you here?
zh: 你到底为什么在这儿？

en: How in the world did you do it?
zh: 你到底是怎么做到的？

en: Why on earth did you sell your newly-built house?
zh: 你到底为什么要卖掉刚盖好的房子？

en: What on earth is the matter?
zh: 到底怎么回事？

en: Whatever is that noise?
zh: 那到底是什么声音？

en: What on earth are you doing in my room?
zh: 你到底在我房间里干嘛？

en: Why on earth did you sell your newly built house?
zh: 你到底为什么要卖掉刚盖好的房子？

en: What the hell are you going to do with it?
zh: 你到底想拿这东西干嘛？

en: What in the world are you getting at?
zh: 你到底想说什么？

en: Can you speak English at all?
zh: 你到底会不会说英语？

en: What was it that you gave him?
zh: 你到底给了他什么？

en: What the devil are you doing?
zh: 你到底在搞什么鬼？

en: I don't know what kind of creature is making such a terrible noise outside tonight.
zh: 我不知道今晚外面到底是什么东西在发出这么恐怖的声音。

en: Where on earth did you meet him?
zh: 你到底是在哪儿见到他的？

en: How in the world did you do such a thing?
zh: 你到底怎么会做出这种事来？

en: How on earth did you know that?
zh: 你到底是怎么知道的？

en: How on earth can we restore our youth?
zh: 到底怎么才能返老还童呢？

en: What's the big idea?
zh: 你想干嘛？

en: Who's gone and messed up my list of names?
zh: 谁把我的名单给弄乱了？

en: Can the report be true?
zh: 那个报道能是真的吗？

en: Can the rumor be true?
zh: 这传闻能是真的吗？

en: What ever do you want with me?
zh: 你到底找我干嘛？

en: What on earth are you doing?
zh: 你到底在干嘛？

en: Only one stack had a real bill on top.
zh: 只有一叠最上面放了张真钱。

en: Let's take a break.
zh: 咱们歇会儿吧。

en: To kill two birds with one stone.
zh: 一举两得。

en: Is it about ten million yen?
zh: 大概是一千万日元吗？

en: At one time, people would not have hesitated to light up a cigarette in stations, restaurants, or hospital waiting rooms.
zh: 以前人们在车站、餐厅或者医院候诊室里抽烟都不带犹豫的。

en: Don't risk putting everything in one boat.
zh: 别把鸡蛋都放在一个篮子里。

en: There was a ship sailing on the sea.
zh: 海上有一艘船在航行。

en: If you work hard, you'll pass your exam.
zh: 只要努力，你就能通过考试。

en: He said to me, "Study hard, and you will pass the test."
zh: 他跟我说：“好好学，你就能考过。”

en: Whoever studies hard cannot fail to succeed.
zh: 只要努力学就肯定能成功。

en: If he studied hard, he would pass the test.
zh: 要是他努力学，他就能考过。

en: It will pay you to study hard.
zh: 好好学习对你有好处。

en: Work hard, or you'll have to take the same course again next year.
zh: 努力点儿，不然明年你还得重修。

en: Study hard, and you'll succeed.
zh: 好好学，你会成功的。

en: Work hard, and you will pass the examination.
zh: 努力点，你就能考过。

en: Study hard, or you'll fail the exam.
zh: 好好学，不然你考试得挂。

en: Work hard, or you will fail the examination.
zh: 努力点儿，不然你考不过。

en: He said to me, 'Study hard, or you won't pass the test.'
zh: 他跟我说：“好好学，不然你考不过。”

en: If you don't study hard, you'll continue to get poor scores.
zh: 你不努力学的话，成绩还是会很差。

en: Hard work enabled him to get good marks.
zh: 努力让他拿到了好成绩。

en: There's a fortune in the making for any hard worker.
zh: 只要努力，肯定能发财。

en: Those who work hard will succeed.
zh: 努力的人会成功的。

en: You can make your dream come true by working hard.
zh: 只要努力，你就能实现梦想。

en: Work hard, and you will succeed.
zh: 努力点儿，你会成功的。

en: Work hard, and your salary will be raised by degrees.
zh: 努力干，工资会慢慢涨上来的。

en: You won't succeed unless you work hard.
zh: 不努力是不可能成功的。

en: Nothing is more pleasant than taking a rest after hard work.
zh: 辛苦工作后休息一下，那是再舒服不过了。

en: He must be tired after such hard work.
zh: 这么辛苦地工作，他肯定累坏了。

en: He remained poor despite being a hard worker.
zh: 虽然他挺努力的，但还是很穷。

en: He worked hard.
zh: 他干活很卖力。

en: After much effort, he ended up with a contract.
zh: 费了好大劲，他终于签到了合同。

en: I ran and ran, but missed the train.
zh: 我跑啊跑，还是没赶上火车。

en: I ran as fast as I could.
zh: 我拼了命地跑。

en: I know you worked very hard on it, but still I'm not satisfied with your report.
zh: 我知道你挺努力的，但我对这份报告还是不太满意。

en: With great effort she managed to fold one more.
zh: 她费了好大劲，总算又叠了一个。

en: What are you doing so hard?
zh: 你在忙什么呢，这么拼命？

en: If he tries hard, he will succeed.
zh: 要是他努力点，他会成功的。

en: You can't get ahead if you don't work hard.
zh: 不努力是没法出人头地的。

en: If he tried hard, he would succeed.
zh: 只要他肯努力，就会成功。

en: You cannot make a good mark without working hard.
zh: 不努力是拿不到好成绩的。

en: I decided that I was going to work as hard as I can.
zh: 我决定要尽全力去拼一把。

en: I mean to fight hard.
zh: 我打算拼死一搏。

en: Hard work and dedication will bring you success.
zh: 努力和投入会带给你成功。

en: It is good to keep studying all your life.
zh: 活到老学到老是件好事。

en: I'm trying hard, but can't think of her name.
zh: 我使劲儿想了，但就是想不起她的名字。

en: Youth comes but once in life.
zh: 青春只有一次。

en: This is the most embarrassing moment of my life.
zh: 这是我这辈子最尴尬的时刻。

en: That might be the most painful experience in my life.
zh: 那可能是我这辈子最痛苦的经历了。

en: You'll be able to speak English better if you practice hard.
zh: 你要是努力练习，英语会说得更好的。

en: If you try very hard, you will succeed.
zh: 只要你够努力，你就一定会成功。

en: I'd been cheated out of my life savings!
zh: 我这辈子的积蓄都被骗光了！

en: I think it is my business to study hard.
zh: 我觉得努力学习是我分内的事。

en: I'll get even with you, if it takes me the rest of my life.
zh: 就算花上一辈子，我也要跟你把这笔账算清。

en: Only after a century and a half of confusion was the royal authority restored.
zh: 经过了一个半世纪的动荡，皇权才得以恢复。

en: Who can read the future?
zh: 谁能预知未来呢？

en: The worm turns.
zh: 兔子急了还咬人。

en: A gust of wind swelled the sails.
zh: 一阵风吹过，帆鼓了起来。

en: Nothing is so pleasant as traveling alone.
zh: 没有什么比独自旅行更惬意的了。

en: My parents objected to my traveling alone, saying it would be dangerous.
zh: 我爸妈反对我一个人去旅游，说太危险了。

en: I began living by myself.
zh: 我开始一个人住了。

en: Living on my own, I really miss my mom's cooking.
zh: 自己住以后，我真的很想念我妈做的菜。

en: It was a great tragedy for them to lose their only son.
zh: 失去独生子对他们来说是个巨大的悲剧。

en: Left alone, the baby began to cry.
zh: 把宝宝一个人留下，他就开始哭了。

en: One murder makes a villain, millions a hero.
zh: 杀一人是罪犯，杀万人是英雄。

en: Each man stood up in turn and introduced himself.
zh: 每个人轮流站起来做了自我介绍。

en: If each would sweep before the door, we should have a clean city.
zh: 如果每个人都能把自己门前打扫干净，我们的城市就会很整洁了。

en: Choose the one.
zh: 就选那一个吧。

en: All but one were present.
zh: 除了一个人，其他人都到了。

en: All except one agreed to his plan.
zh: 除了一个人没同意，其他人都赞成他的计划。

en: Left alone, the little girl began to cry.
zh: 小女孩一个人待着的时候就开始哭了。

en: One is a teacher, another is a doctor, and the other is a journalist.
zh: 一个是老师，一个是医生，还有一个是记者。

en: One stayed and the other went away.
zh: 一个留下了，另一个走了。

en: I dislike being alone.
zh: 我不喜欢一个人待着。

en: The bus was empty except for one elderly woman.
zh: 公交车上除了一个老太太，没别人。

en: An old man was at rest under the tree.
zh: 一个老人正在树下休息。

en: An old man broke into our conversation.
zh: 一个老头儿突然插话打断了我们的谈话。

en: An old man came along.
zh: 走过来一个老头儿。

en: One eyewitness is better than ten earwitnesses.
zh: 百闻不如一见。

en: One father is more than a hundred schoolmasters.
zh: 一个父亲胜过一百个老师。

en: A man overtook her.
zh: 一个男的超到了她前面。

en: A man drew near.
zh: 有个男人走近了。

en: A man came up to me and asked for a match.
zh: 一个男人走过来向我要火柴。

en: No student was able to answer the question.
zh: 没有学生能回答这个问题。

en: A man appeared at the site.
zh: 一个男人出现在了现场。

en: A passenger fainted, but the stewardess brought him round.
zh: 一个乘客晕倒了，但空姐把他弄醒了。

en: A girl approached the king from among the crowd.
zh: 一个女孩从人群中走向国王。

en: A boy is walking across the street.
zh: 一个男孩正穿过马路。

en: I found that there was a little girl sobbing.
zh: 我发现有个小女孩在抽泣。

en: A woman appeared from behind a tree.
zh: 一个女人从树后面钻了出来。

en: Within every man are thousands.
zh: 每个人的内心都藏着千万个自我。

en: One of his colleagues whispered.
zh: 他的一位同事小声嘀咕了一句。

en: A student with a crew cut was sitting in the front seat.
zh: 前排坐着一个留平头的学生。

en: The moment she was alone she opened the letter.
zh: 她一独处就拆开了那封信。

en: When left alone, he cried to his heart's content.
zh: 没人的时候，他痛痛快快地哭了一场。

en: The little boy got into mischief when he was left alone.
zh: 小男孩一个人待着的时候就开始淘气了。

en: Left alone, I sometimes feel like crying.
zh: 一个人待着的时候，我有时会想哭。

en: Left to itself, the baby cried itself to sleep.
zh: 没人管的时候，宝宝哭着哭着就睡着了。

en: Left alone, he began to read a book.
zh: 就剩他一个人的时候，他开始看起书来。

en: I like to travel by myself.
zh: 我喜欢一个人旅游。

en: Nothing is so pleasant as travelling alone.
zh: 没什么比一个人旅行更开心的了。

en: I got accustomed to living alone.
zh: 我习惯一个人住了。

en: Can you put on a kimono by yourself?
zh: 你能自己穿和服吗？

en: Is it dangerous to take a subway alone?
zh: 一个人坐地铁危险吗？

en: One can't help many, but many can help one.
zh: 一个人帮不了所有人，但大家能帮一个人。

en: It is lonely to live alone.
zh: 一个人住挺孤单的。

en: Instead of going myself, I sent a messenger.
zh: 我没亲自去，而是派人跑了一趟。

en: I'd rather stay home than go alone.
zh: 我宁愿待在家里，也不想一个人去。

en: Let me go alone.
zh: 让我一个人去吧。

en: I don't want to go alone.
zh: 我不想一个人去。

en: She allowed him to go alone.
zh: 她允许他一个人去。

en: It was careless of her to go out alone.
zh: 她一个人出门太不小心了。

en: Though she wished to travel abroad by herself, she thought better of it.
zh: 虽然她想一个人出国旅游，但后来还是打消了这个念头。

en: You cannot lift the piano alone.
zh: 你一个人搬不动这架钢琴。

en: I think it's dangerous to climb that mountain alone.
zh: 我觉得一个人去爬那座山太危险了。

en: Can you move this desk by yourself?
zh: 你能自己搬动这张桌子吗？

en: Did you come here alone?
zh: 你是一个人来的吗？

en: One person more or less doesn't make much difference.
zh: 多一个人少一个人没啥区别。

en: Each individual paid 1,000 dollars.
zh: 每个人付了一千块。

en: The admission is ten dollars a person.
zh: 门票每人十块钱。

en: For personal reasons.
zh: 因为个人原因。

en: It's good to be able to concentrate single-mindedly on your work, but you're completely ignoring the people around you.
zh: 一心扑在工作上是好事，但你完全不顾周围的人了。

en: It won't hurt you to skip one meal.
zh: 少吃一顿饭也没什么大不了的。

en: Take me with you.
zh: 带上我吧。

en: Won't you come with me?
zh: 你不跟我一起来吗？

en: Come with me, will you?
zh: 跟我一起走，好吗？

en: I'm sorry for your not having come with us.
zh: 很遗憾你没跟我们一起来。

en: Would you play with me?
zh: 你想跟我一起玩吗？

en: Won't you go shopping with me?
zh: 要不要跟我一起去逛街？

en: I'm looking forward to serving your company.
zh: 我很期待为贵公司服务。

en: Working together, they cleaned the entire house in no time.
zh: 大家一起动手，很快就把整间屋子打扫干净了。

en: He was always pulling my leg when we worked together.
zh: 我们一起工作的时候，他总爱跟我开玩笑。

en: Come along with me and go fishing.
zh: 跟我一起去钓鱼吧。

en: Do you mind if I join your trip to the country?
zh: 你介意我加入你们的乡间旅行吗？

en: What do you say to going fishing with me?
zh: 跟我一起去钓鱼怎么样？

en: May I run with you?
zh: 我能和你一起跑步吗？

en: What do you say to dining out together?
zh: 咱们一起出去吃饭怎么样？

en: Would you like to have lunch together?
zh: 想一起吃午饭吗？

en: How about eating out with me?
zh: 跟我一起出去吃顿饭怎么样？

en: Can I take your picture with us?
zh: 我能和你合个影吗？

en: Let us go together. We can swim across the river, carry off the bear cubs, take them to the house on the mountain, and together find happiness.
zh: 咱们一起去吧。我们可以游过河，抱走那些小熊崽，把它们带到山上的房子里，一起寻找幸福。

en: I wish I could go with you, but as it is, I can't.
zh: 我真想跟你一起去，但现在的确去不了。

en: I would like to go with you.
zh: 我想跟你一起去。

en: Do you want to come along?
zh: 你想一起去吗？

en: Let's work together to do our best.
zh: 咱们一起努力吧。

en: Put it on one bill, please.
zh: 请把账结在一起。

en: Let's sing some English songs together.
zh: 咱们一起唱几首英文歌吧。

en: Will you join us for a swim?
zh: 你想和我们一起去游泳吗？
